newsitem.title: MACEDONIA: Philip Morris signs Macedonia tobacco deal.
newsitem.headline: Philip Morris signs Macedonia tobacco deal.

text.p: Tobacco companies Macedonian Tobacco Industry of Prilep, Makedonija Tabak and Philip Morris Cos Inc signed on Wednesday a licence deal on the production, distribution and sale of Partner and Bond Street cigarettes, the daily Nova Makedonija reported on Thursday.
The private A1 television quoted the head of Makedonija Tabak, Straso Nelovski, as saying the list of cigarettes will be extended to LM, Marlboro, Chesterfield and other brands.

Jean Claude Kunze, Vice-President of the Central Europe Philip Morris company, told a news conference in Prilep on Wednesday that his company "believes the Macedonian government will continue to stimulate tobacco production".
"Macedonia is one of the leading countries growing oriental tobacco in Europe," he said.
Makedonija Tabak sells 150,000 tonnes of high quality oriental tobacco to 25 countries in the world, including the United States, western Europe, Japan and Korea.
Annual tobacco exports, including cigarettes, are valued at over $100 million, Nova Makedonija said.
